description: Indicates the current state of this cluster network.
interpretation: Values: Up (100), Partitioned (70), Down (50), Unavailable (30), Unknown (10).
troubleshootingSteps: If status is 'Partitioned', check physical connectivity and VLAN configuration between nodes; a partitioned state often means some nodes can communicate on this network while others cannot.[web:310][web:455][web:460]
Verify that all nodes have correct and matching IP subnet masks and that no duplicate IP addresses exist on the network segment.[web:456][web:460]
If the network is 'Down' or 'Unavailable', inspect the network adapters on all nodes; ensure they are enabled, connected, and that the Cluster Service is running.[web:309][web:452][web:453]
Check for firewall rules blocking UDP/TCP port 3343 or ICMP (Ping), which are required for heartbeat and status updates.[web:312][web:455]

If the issue persists after correcting network settings, try disabling and re-enabling the network adapter or restarting the Cluster Service on the affected node to force a topology refresh.[web:453][web:457][web:460]
